sen.j: 京都御馬揃え（きょうとおんうまそろえ?）は天正9年2月28日_(旧暦)（1581年4月1日）、織田信長が京都で行った大規模な軍事パレードである。
sen.e: Kyoto Onuma soroe was the great military parade in Kyoto which was staged by Nobunaga ODA on April 1, 1581.
Kyoto Onuma soroe was the great military parade in Kyoto which was staged by Nobunaga ODA on April 11, 1581.

sen.j: この馬揃えは京都内裏東にて行われた。
sen.e: This parade was held in the east of Kyoto Dairi (Imperial palace).

sen.j: 丹羽長秀や柴田勝家を始め、中国軍団の豊臣秀吉を除く織田軍団の各軍を総動員する大規模なものだった。
sen.e: Beginning with Nagahide NIWA and Katsuie SHIBATA, it was a great parade that mobilized every armies of the Oda army, with the exception of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI who headed the Chugoku army.

sen.j: 正親町天皇が招待され、近衛前久ら馬術に通じた公家にはパレードへの参加が許された。
sen.e: Emperor Ogimachi was invited, and those court nobles who were well acquainted with horse-back archery technique were given permission to take part in the parade.
Emperor Ogimachi was invited, and those court nobles, who were well acquainted with horse-back archery technique including Sakihisa KONOE, were given permission to take part in the parade.

sen.j: このパレードの目的は、織田信長天下布武を標榜する織田信長が、周辺大名を牽制し、力を誇示するためと考えられている。
sen.e: It is thought that the aim of the parade was for Nobunaba ODA who professed himself as "Nobunaga ODA Tenka fubu" (Nobunaga ODA governs the entire world) to restrain the surrounding Daimyo and to display his power.

sen.j: これにより、信長は京都の平和回復と織田氏の天下掌握を内外に知らしめた。
sen.e: As a result, Nobunaga let known both inside and outside of Kyoto that peace has come back to Kyoto and that the Oda clan has gained control of the world.

sen.j: また、天皇や公家を招待した理由については、朝廷を威圧するためという説と、天皇側から閲覧を希望したという説とがある。
sen.e: Furthermore, there are two theories regarding Nobunaga ODA's reasons for inviting the Emperor and court nobles: that it was to overpower the Imperial Court, and that it was the Emperor who had requested to see the parade.
